catalog_info.title: Writing Across Cultures: Literatures of the World (from 1750 to the present)
catalog_info.description: An overview of world literature in the modern period through a series of international styles and literary ideological movements. In lectures, discussions, and close readings of theoretical and imaginative texts from around the world, we will examine "world literature" as an emerging concept in relation to such forces as censorship, propaganda, translation, centers, contact zones, and canon formation.
